sols_html:
The given problem is equivalent to \(\displaystyle x^{2} \equiv 4 \mod{5}\). Testing all points gives

\[\begin{aligned} 0^{2} &\equiv 0 \mod{5}\\ 1^{2} &\equiv 1 \mod{5}\\ 2^{2} &\equiv 4 \mod{5}\\ 3^{2} &\equiv 4 \mod{5}\\ 4^{2} &\equiv 1 \mod{5}\end{aligned}\]

and so the smallest admissible integer is \(\displaystyle x \equiv 2 \mod{5}\)

3^{2} &\equiv 4 \mod{5}\\
4^{2} &\equiv 1 \mod{5}
\end{align*}

$\displaystyle x \equiv 2 \mod{5}$
